Articles.Content:
This tutorial focuses on reaching orbit using gravity turns in KSP. I'm not talking the control-input heavy gravity turns of the past, I mean tipping over at the right time and letting drag and gravity do all of the rest of the work for you for a nice stable ascent into space! This really only became possible in 1.0 due to new aero, though.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ukeDUn1venA?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
Thanks for sharing this, my son is really having trouble with the new aerodynamic changes since 1.0

More Tutorial! This time, we take a look at a more advanced tutorial: Launching a Tech-2 rocket into Orbit! No tail-fins, little room for error, just an ambitious desire to get into orbit quickly!

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/0pA1y5a5rnk?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Really nice, thanks for the "no hands on keyboard" thing and the fins placement.

I really have issues with this version to be on orbit each time ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)
